title: Chicken breast Garam masala bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss cherry tomatoes and spinach with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season chicken breast and place on the tray. Air-fry for 20 min, turning once.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Season tempeh and place on the tray. Roast for 37 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Catalan Chicken breast with Sourdough bread & Courgette
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry courgette and green beans with thai green curry paste 5 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Asparagus & Green beans Jasmine rice with Paneer
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix paneer with italian herbs and a pinch of salt.
Layer with asparagus, green beans and jasmine rice.
Cook the jasmine rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Jasmine rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Korean Chickpeas with Sourdough bread & Onion
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss onion and carrots with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and lemon & herb; spread on a tray.
Season chickpeas and place on the tray. Air-fry for 20 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Eggs Italian herbs bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix eggs with italian herbs and a pinch of salt.
Layer with broccoli, cherry tomatoes and baby potatoes.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Welsh High-Protein Yogurt Bowl with Carrots & Couscous
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat grill to high.
Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook greek yogurt (0%) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry carrots and aubergine with thai green curry paste 10 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Onion & Peas Couscous with Tempeh
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix tempeh with garam masala and a pinch of salt.
Layer with onion, peas and couscous.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
